title: LBD Paper Categorization Schema
description: Schema for categorizing literature-based discovery papers using a two-tier system

paperId.description: Unique identifier for the paper (e.g., Semantic Scholar ID, DOI, or internal ID)

overallType.description: Tier 1 categorization: overall paper type (all papers receive exactly one)

isLLMBased.description: True if paper uses LLMs (GPT, BERT, etc.) as PRIMARY mechanism for hypothesis generation

shouldFilterOut.description: True if paper should be filtered from LBD corpus (currently only 'New Method (LLM-based)' papers)

oneOf.description: Null for all non-method papers (everything except 'New Method (LBD)' and 'New Method (LLM-based)')

datasets.description: List of datasets used for evaluation. Common values: 'PubMed/MEDLINE', 'HetioNet', 'DrugBank', 'KEGG', 'Custom corpus', 'Not specified'

dataRepresentation.description: How literature data is structured for computational processing

primaryEvaluationMetric.description: The MAIN metric used to evaluate method performance. Common values: 'AUC-ROC', 'Precision', 'Recall', 'F1-score', 'Hits@K', 'MRR', 'Qualitative assessment', 'Not specified'

secondaryEvaluationMetrics.description: Additional metrics reported beyond primary metric. Can be empty array if only one metric used. Do NOT duplicate primary metric.

dataSplitMethod.description: How the dataset is divided into training and test sets

discoveryMechanism.description: Optional: The core computational approach used to generate hypotheses

domain.description: Optional: The application domain or scientific field targeted by the method

validationType.description: Optional: How the discovered hypotheses or predictions are validated

confidence.description: Confidence level in the categorization. High: clearly fits category, all info available. Medium: some ambiguity or missing optional fields. Low: significant ambiguity or missing required info.

reasoning.description: Brief explanation (2-3 sentences) of why this categorization was chosen, citing key indicators from title/abstract

notes.description: Optional: Additional notes about ambiguous cases, missing information, alternative categories considered, or other relevant observations

examples.reasoning: Paper proposes a novel graph neural network architecture for link prediction in drug-disease associations. Clear algorithmic contribution with comprehensive evaluation on standard biomedical knowledge graphs.
Paper uses GPT-4 as the core mechanism for hypothesis generation in materials science. This is LLM-based discovery belonging to 'LLM ideation' taxonomy rather than traditional LBD.
examples.notes: Should be filtered from LBD corpus and categorized under LLM ideation taxonomy instead.

examples.reasoning: Comprehensive systematic review of 87 methods with structured categorization. No new method proposed; contribution is the survey itself with taxonomy and evaluation practice analysis.
Paper describes web platform integrating existing NLP tools and databases. Uses 'existing link prediction algorithms' indicating no algorithmic novelty - system integration contribution.
Paper argues for conceptual approach to semantic integration and proposes conceptual framework extending Swanson's model. No implementation provided, focus is on ideas and research agenda.
